data.name: EvaluationState0
data.value: State information is not available

data.name: EvaluationState1
data.value: Application is enforced to desired/resolved state.

data.name: EvaluationState10
data.value: Application is currently waiting for serialized enforcement.

data.name: EvaluationState11
data.value: Application is currently enforcing dependencies.

data.name: EvaluationState12
data.value: Application is currently enforcing.

data.name: EvaluationState13
data.value: Application install/uninstall enforced and soft reboot is pending.

data.name: EvaluationState14
data.value: Application installed/uninstalled and hard reboot is pending.

data.name: EvaluationState15
data.value: Update is available but pending installation.

data.name: EvaluationState16
data.value: Application failed to evaluate.

data.name: EvaluationState17
data.value: Application is currently waiting for an active user session to enforce.

data.name: EvaluationState18
data.value: Application is currently waiting for all users to logoff.

data.name: EvaluationState19
data.value: Application is currently waiting for a user logon.

data.name: EvaluationState2
data.value: Application is not required on the client.

data.name: EvaluationState20
data.value: Application in progress, waiting for retry.

data.name: EvaluationState21
data.value: Application is waiting for presentation mode to be switched off.

data.name: EvaluationState22
data.value: Application is pre-downloading content (downloading outside of install job).

data.name: EvaluationState23
data.value: Application is pre-downloading dependent content (downloading outside of install job).

data.name: EvaluationState24
data.value: Application download failed (downloading during install job).

data.name: EvaluationState25
data.value: Application pre-downloading failed (downloading outside of install job).

data.name: EvaluationState26
data.value: Download success (downloading during install job).

data.name: EvaluationState27
data.value: Post-enforce evaluation.

data.name: EvaluationState28
data.value: Waiting for network connectivity.

data.name: EvaluationState3
data.value: Application is available for enforcement (install or uninstall based on resolved state). Content may/may not have been downloaded.

data.name: EvaluationState4
data.value: Application last failed to enforce (install/uninstall).

data.name: EvaluationState5
data.value: Application is currently waiting for content download to complete.

data.name: EvaluationState6
data.value: Application is currently waiting for content download to complete.

data.name: EvaluationState7
data.value: Application is currently waiting for its dependencies to download.

data.name: EvaluationState8
data.value: Application is currently waiting for a service (maintenance) window.

data.name: EvaluationState9
data.value: Application is currently waiting for a previously pending reboot.

data.name: EvaluationStateElse
data.value: State information is not available

data.name: Message_Delete_TS
data.value: Do you want to remove this Task Sequence?

data.name: AppDiscovery
data.value: Records details about the discovery or detection of applications on client computers.

data.name: AppEnforce
data.value: Records details about enforcement actions (install and uninstall) taken for applications on the client.

data.name: AppIntentEval
data.value: Records details about the current and intended state of applications, their applicability, whether requirements were met, deployment types, and dependencies.

data.name: AssetAdvisor
data.value: Records the activities of Asset Intelligence inventory actions.

data.name: BgbHttpProxy
data.value: Records the activities of the notification HTTP proxy as it relays the messages of clients using HTTP to and from the notification server.

data.name: CAS
data.value: The Content Access service. Maintains the local package cache on the client.

data.name: Ccm32BitLauncher
data.value: Records actions for starting applications on the client marked "run as 32bit".

data.name: CcmEval
data.value: Records Configuration Manager client status evaluation activities and details for components that are required by the Configuration Manager client.

data.name: CcmEvalTask
data.value: Records the Configuration Manager client status evaluation activities that are initiated by the evaluation scheduled task.

data.name: CcmExec
data.value: Records activities of the client and the SMS Agent Host service. This log file also includes information about enabling and disabling wake-up proxy.

data.name: CcmMessaging
data.value: Records activities related to communication between the client and management points.

data.name: CCMNotificationAgent
data.value: Records activities related to client notification operations.

data.name: Ccmperf
data.value: Records activities related to the maintenance and capture of data related to client performance counters.

data.name: CcmRepair
data.value: Records the repair activities of the client agent.

data.name: CcmRestart
data.value: Records client service restart activity.

data.name: CCMSDKProvider
data.value: Records activities for the client SDK interfaces.

data.name: ccmsetup
data.value: Records ccmsetup.exe tasks for client setup, client upgrade, and client removal. Can be used to troubleshoot client installation problems.

data.name: ccmsetup_ccmeval
data.value: Records ccmsetup.exe tasks for client status and remediation.

data.name: CertificateMaintenance
data.value: Maintains certificates for Active Directory Domain Services and management points.

data.name: CIAgent
data.value: Records details about the process of remediation and compliance for compliance settings, software updates, and application management.

data.name: CIDownloader
data.value: Records details about configuration item definition downloads.

data.name: CITaskManager
data.value: Records information about configuration item task scheduling.

data.name: CITaskMgr
data.value: Records tasks that are initiated for each application and deployment type, such as content download and install or uninstall actions.

data.name: ClientAuth
data.value: Records signing and authentication activity for the client.

data.name: ClientIDManagerStartup
data.value: Creates and maintains the client GUID and identifies tasks performed during client registration and assignment.

data.name: ClientLocation
data.value: Records tasks that are related to client site assignment.

data.name: client_msi
data.value: Records setup tasks performed by client.msi. Can be used to troubleshoot client installation or removal problems.

data.name: CMHttpsReadiness
data.value: Records the results of running the Configuration Manager HTTPS Readiness Assessment Tool. This tool checks whether computers have a public key infrastructure (PKI) client authentication certificate that can be used with Configuration Manager.

data.name: CmRcService
data.value: Records information for the remote control service.

data.name: ConfigMgrSoftwareCatalog
data.value: Records the activity of the Application Catalog, which includes its use of Silverlight.

data.name: ContentTransferManager
data.value: Schedules the Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) or Server Message Block (SMB) to download or access packages.

data.name: DataTransferService
data.value: Records all BITS communication for policy or package access.

data.name: DCMAgent
data.value: Records high-level information about the evaluation, conflict reporting, and remediation of configuration items and applications.

data.name: DCMReporting
data.value: Records information about reporting policy platform results into state messages for configuration items.

data.name: DcmWmiProvider
data.value: Records information about reading configuration item synclets from WMI.

data.name: EndpointProtectionAgent
data.value: Records information about the installation of the System Center Endpoint Protection client and the application of antimalware policy to that client.

data.name: execmgr
data.value: Records details about packages and task sequences that run on the client.

data.name: ExpressionSolver
data.value: Records details about enhanced detection methods that are used when verbose or debug logging is turned on.

data.name: ExternalEventAgent
data.value: Records the history of Endpoint Protection malware detection and events related to client status.

data.name: FileBITS
data.value: Records all SMB package access tasks.

data.name: FileSystemFile
data.value: Records the activity of the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) provider for software inventory and file collection.

data.name: FSPStateMessage
data.value: Records the activity for state messages that are sent to the fallback status point by the client.

data.name: InternetProxy
data.value: Records the network proxy configuration and use activity for the client.

data.name: InventoryAgent
data.value: Records activities of hardware inventory, software inventory, and heartbeat discovery actions on the client.

data.name: loadstate
data.value: Records details about the User State Migration Tool (USMT) and restoring user state data.

data.name: LocationCache
data.value: Records the activity for location cache use and maintenance for the client.

data.name: LocationServices
data.value: Records the client activity for locating management points, software update points, and distribution points.

data.name: MaintenanceCoordinator
data.value: Records the activity for general maintenance tasks for the client.

data.name: Mifprovider
data.value: Records the activity of the WMI provider for Management Information Format (MIF) files.

data.name: mtrmgr
data.value: Monitors all software metering processes.

data.name: PolicyAgent
data.value: Records requests for policies made by using the Data Transfer Service.

data.name: PolicyAgentProvider
data.value: Records policy changes.

data.name: PolicyEvaluator
data.value: Records details about the evaluation of policies on client computers, including policies from software updates.

data.name: PolicyPlatformClient
data.value: Records the process of remediation and compliance for all providers located in \Program Files\Microsoft Policy Platform, except the file provider.

data.name: PolicySdk
data.value: Records activities for policy system SDK interfaces.

data.name: Pwrmgmt
data.value: Records information about enabling or disabling and configuring the wake-up proxy client settings.

data.name: PwrProvider
data.value: Records the activities of the power management provider (PWRInvProvider) hosted in the WMI service. On all supported versions of Windows, the provider enumerates the current settings on computers during hardware inventory and applies power plan settings.

data.name: RebootCoordinator
data.value: Records details about the coordination of system restarts on client computers after software update installations.

data.name: ScanAgent
data.value: Records details about scan requests for software updates, the WSUS location, and related actions.

data.name: scanstate
data.value: Records details about the User State Migration Tool (USMT) and capturing user state data.

data.name: Scheduler
data.value: Records activities of scheduled tasks for all client operations.

data.name: SdmAgent
data.value: Records details about the tracking of remediation and compliance. However, the software updates log file, Updateshandler.log, provides more informative details about installing the software updates that are required for compliance. This log file is shared with compliance settings.

data.name: ServiceWindowManager
data.value: Records details about the evaluation of maintenance windows.

data.name: Setupact
data.value: Records details about Windows Sysprep and setup logs.

data.name: Setupapi
data.value: Records details about Windows Sysprep and setup logs.

data.name: Setuperr
data.value: Records details about Windows Sysprep and setup logs.

data.name: setuppolicyevaluator
data.value: Records configuration and inventory policy creation in WMI.

data.name: smpisapi
data.value: Records details about the client state capture and restore actions, and threshold information.

data.name: smscliui
data.value: Records use of the Configuration Manager client in Control Panel.

data.name: Smsts
data.value: Records task sequence activities.

data.name: SmsWusHandler
data.value: Records details about the scan process for the Inventory Tool for Microsoft Updates.

data.name: SoftwareCatalogUpdateEndpoint
data.value: Records activities for managing the URL for the Application Catalog shown in Software Center.

data.name: SoftwareCenterSystemTasks
data.value: Records activities related to Software Center prerequisite component validation.

data.name: SrcUpdateMgr
data.value: Records activity for installed Windows Installer applications that are updated with current distribution point source locations.

data.name: StateMessage
data.value: Records details about software update state messages that are created and sent to the management point.

data.name: StatusAgent
data.value: Records status messages that are created by the client components.

data.name: SWMTRReportGen
data.value: Generates a use data report that is collected by the metering agent. This data is logged in Mtrmgr.log.

data.name: TSAgent
data.value: Records the outcome of task sequence dependencies before starting a task sequence.

data.name: UpdatesDeployment
data.value: Records details about deployments on the client, including software update activation, evaluation, and enforcement. Verbose logging shows additional information about the interaction with the client user interface.

data.name: UpdatesHandler
data.value: Records details about software update compliance scanning and about the download and installation of software updates on the client.

data.name: UpdatesStore
data.value: Records details about compliance status for the software updates that were assessed during the compliance scan cycle.

data.name: UserAffinity
data.value: Records details about user device affinity.

data.name: VirtualApp
data.value: Records information specific to the evaluation of Application Virtualization (App-V) deployment types.

data.name: wakeprxy_install
data.value: Records installation information when clients receive the client setting option to turn on wake-up proxy.

data.name: wakeprxy_uninstall
data.value: Records information about uninstalling wake-up proxy when clients receive the client setting option to turn off wake-up proxy, if wake-up proxy was previously turned on.

data.name: Wedmtrace
data.value: Records operations related to write filters on Windows Embedded clients.

data.name: WindowsUpdate
data.value: Records details about when the Windows Update Agent connects to the WSUS server and retrieves the software updates for compliance assessment, and whether there are updates to the agent components.

data.name: WUAHandler
data.value: Records details about the Windows Update Agent on the client when it searches for software updates.

data.name: Message_file_ini_missing
data.value: The SCCMPCADMIN.INI file is missing.

data.name: Message_long_wait_time
data.value: You are about to re-install the SCCM client, this may take a while.

data.name: Message_Domain_Missing
data.value: The computer must be joined to a domain before reinstalling the SCCM client.

data.name: Missing_INI_Files
data.value: The file "C:\Utils-outils\SCCMPCAdmin\SCCMPCAdmin.ini" has missing, please sure you have all files present before run SCCMPCAdmin

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_1
data.value: Prevents CCMSetup from running as a service, which is the default. When CCMSetup runs as a service, it runs in the context of the Local System account of the computer, which might not have sufficient rights to access required network resources for the installation. With /noservice, CCMSetup.exe runs in the context of the user account that you use to start the installation. Also, if you are use a script to run CCMSetup.exe with the /service property, CCMSetup.exe exits after the service starts and might not report installation details correctly.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_10
data.value: Specifies the download priority when client installation files are downloaded over an HTTP connection. Possible values are as follows: FOREGROUND, HIGH, NORMAL, LOW. The default value is NORMAL.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_11
data.value: The length of time in minutes that CCMSetup attempts to download the installation files before stopping. The default value is 1440 minutes (1 day).

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_12
data.value: Specifies that CCMSetup.exe must not install the specified prerequisite program when the Configuration Manager client is installed. This property supports entering multiple values. Use the semicolon character (;) to separate each value.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_13
data.value: Use this to indicate a custom command line after the "ccmsetup.exe"

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_14
data.value: Specifies the Configuration Manager site to assign the Configuration Manager client to. This can either be a three-character site code or the word AUTO. If AUTO is specified, or if this property is not specified, the client attempts to determine its Configuration Manager site assignment from Active Directory Domain Services or from a specified management point. To enable AUTO for client upgrades, you must also set SITEREASSIGN to TRUE. Note Do not use AUTO if you also specify the Internet-based management point (CCMHOSTNAME). In that case, you must directly assign the client to its site.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_15
data.value: Specifies an initial management point for the Configuration Manager client to use. If the management point only accepts client connections over HTTPS, you must prefix the management point name with https://.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_16
data.value: Enables debug logging. Values can be set to 0 (off, default) or 1 (on). This causes the client to log low-level information for troubleshooting. As a best practice, avoid using this property in production sites because excessive logging can occur, which might make it difficult to find relevant information in the log files. CCMENABLELOGGING must also be set to TRUE to enable debug logging.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_17
data.value: The frequency at which client health evaluation tool (ccmeval.exe) runs. Can be 1 to 1440 minutes. By default, runs once a day.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_18
data.value: The hour when the client health evaluation tool (ccmeval.exe) runs, between 0 (midnight) and 23 (11pm). Runs at midnight by default.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_19
data.value: Specifies the FQDN of the Internet-based management point, if the client is managed over the Internet. Do not specify this option with the installation property of SMSSITECODE=AUTO. Internet-based clients must be directly assigned to their Internet-based site.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_2
data.value: Specifies that CCMSetup should run as a service that uses the local system account.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_20
data.value: Specifies the port that the client should use when communicating over HTTP to site system servers. Set to Port 80 by default.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_21
data.value: Specifies the port that the client should use when communicating over HTTPS to site system servers. Set to Port 443 by default.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_22
data.value: Specifies the level of detail to write to Configuration Manager log files. Specify an integer from 0 to 3, where 0 is the most verbose logging and 3 logs only errors. The default is 1.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_23
data.value: Specifies a DNS domain for clients to locate management points that are published in DNS. When a management point is located, it informs the client about other management points in the hierarchy. This means that the management point that is located by using DNS publishing does not have to be from the client’s site, but can be any management point in the hierarchy. You do not have to specify this property if the client is in the same domain as a published management point. In that case, the client’s domain is automatically used to search DNS for management points. By default, DNS publishing is not enabled in Configuration Manager.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_24
data.value: Specifies the fallback status point that receives and processes state messages sent by Configuration Manager client computers.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_25
data.value: Enables automatic site reassignment for client upgrades when used with SMSSITECODE=AUTO.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_26
data.value: Specifies that client status will report, but not remediate problems that are found with the client.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_27
data.value: Beginning with Configuration Manager version 1606, new client settings are available for specifying the client cache folder size. The addition of those client settings effectively replaces using SMSCACHESIZE as a client.msi property to specify the size of the client cache. For more information, see the client settings for cache size. For 1602 and earlier, SMSCACHESIZE specifies the size of the client cache folder in megabyte (MB) or as a percentage when used with the PERCENTDISKSPACE or PERCENTFREEDISKSPACE property. If this property is not set, the folder defaults to a maximum size of 5120 MB. The lowest value that you can specify is 1 MB. Note If a new package that must be downloaded would cause the folder to exceed the maximum size, and if the folder cannot be purged to make sufficient space available, the package download fails, and the program or application will not run. This setting is ignored when you upgrade an existing client and when the client downloads software updates. Note If you reinstall a client, you cannot use the SMSCACHESIZE or SMSCACHEFLAGS installation properties to set the cache size to be smaller than it was previously. If you try to do this, your value is ignored and the cache size is automatically set to the size it was previously.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_28
data.value: Specifies whether the client can use Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) to find a management point that accepts HTTP connections. Clients use this method when they cannot find a management point in Active Directory Domain Services or in DNS. This property doesn't affect whether the client uses WINS for name resolution. You can configure two different modes for this property - NOWINS: This is the most secure setting for this property and prevents clients from finding a management point in WINS . When you use this setting, clients must have an alternative method to locate a management point on the intranet, such as Active Directory Domain Services or by using DNS publishing. - WINSSECURE (default): In this mode, a client that uses HTTP communication can use WINS to find a management point. However, the client must have a copy of the trusted root key before it can successfully connect to the management point.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_3
data.value: Specifies that the client software should be uninstalled. For more information, see How to manage clients in System Center Configuration Manager.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_4
data.value: Specifies that the client installation should stop if any version of the client is already installed.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_5
data.value: Specifies that CCMSetup should force the client computer to restart if necessary to complete the installation. If this is not specified, CCMSetup exits when a restart is necessary, and then continues after the next manual restart.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_6
data.value: Specifies that the computer is allowed to restart following the client installation if required. *** Important The computer will restart without warning even if a user is logged on. ***

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_7
data.value: Specifies that a client should not check the certificate revocation list (CRL) when it communicates over HTTPS with a PKI certificate. When not specified, the client checks the CRL before establishing an HTTPS connection. For more information about client CRL checking, see Planning for PKI certificate revocation in Plan for security in System Center Configuration Manager.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_8
data.value: Specify that any existing client will be uninstalled and a new client will be installed.

data.name: CCM_COMMAND_9
data.value: The retry interval if CCMSetup.exe fails to download installation files. CCMSetup continues to retry until it reaches the limit specified in the downloadtimeout property.

data.name: Error_BAD_AD
data.value: The computer you just entered is in an "OU" that is not included in SCCM. Please make sure you have the correct computer name or move it into the proper “OU”.

data.name: Error_BAD_CON
data.value: The computer you just entered cannot be reached. Please make sure you have the correct computer name.
